summary: This bill, the Wildfire Coordination Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Wildfire Science and Technology Advisory Board. The Board's duties include coordinating wildfire research within the Federal Government, encouraging collaboration across disciplines, and disseminating information. The Board will be composed of various federal agency heads and up to 18 non-federal members representing state, local, tribal governments and relevant stakeholders. It will report to Congress on its activities, research transition, and recommend future priorities. The act authorizes $10 million in appropriations.
